main event: A green fireball was sighted in the northeastern sky at 1935 hours MST on 4 December 1949 by a civilian employee at Holloman Air Force Base in Alamogordo, New Mexico.
interesting points: The object observed was described as a green fireball with sparks emanating from it, which were more pronounced in the lower rear edge and appeared orange to white in color.
No visible clouds or lights were associated with the object, and no supports, propulsions, air ducts, or sound were observed.
The observer, a geodetic engineer well-versed in astronomy, was deemed extremely reliable and had aided the office on numerous occasions in obtaining readings on other observations.

Checks with radar, Base Weather Station, Operations and Projects Division at Holloman Air Force Base, and the Research Section of White Sands Proving Ground revealed no unusual weather conditions or testing devices sent aloft in the vicinity at the time of the sighting.
The sighting was labeled as a 'special inquiry - unconventional aircraft', and the report was downgraded and declassified after a certain number of years, as per DOD directive.
witnesses: civilian employee at Holloman Air Force Base
